text: once upon a time in a little village
there lived a farmer with his wife and
his three children both his eldest and
youngest were very helpful they would do
whatever their father asked of them but
the middle kid Andy would think of
nothing but painting and drawing and
what did he draw cats Andy where are you
oh hey Dad I was just drawing this
beautiful cat do you like it of course I
do the same way I liked all the other
cats you drew look son you have got to
stop drawing so many cats
what father I don't draw them just for
fun I have tried drawing other animals
and things but when I draw cats it's
like they speak to me
father was very annoyed with Andy Andy I
want you to help me in the field and you
don't even do that the next time I see
you drawing cats I will send you to the
stage at the end of the village what no
I don't want to go there well you'll
have to if you don't listen to me now
come and help me carry the potatoes poor
Andy didn't like working in a field he
only thought of drawing cats
he saw cats wherever he looked and would
never get tired of them one day the
father came to look for Andy who seemed
to have disappeared where is that boy
and I want someone to carry the wheat
for me what's that
as he moved through the field
soon saw Andy sitting and playing with a
very grumpy looking cat I can't take
this anymore
Andy my boy tomorrow we must go to the
sage and ask him what he can teach you
because drawing cats isn't going to keep
you happy forever but father this is
what I like to do but Andy's father was
determined to get Andy to stop drawing
cats so later that day they both went to
visit the old sage the old sage greeted
them and asked why they had come there
[Music]
well you see my father doesn't like me
because uh it's not that I don't like
him my boy Andy here doesn't do any good
work a strong boy like him should well
then what does he do he paints and that
too cats only those silly whisker
creatures yes dad I told you it's
because the cats speak to me - you know
their sounds interesting mm-hmm
and he told the sage everything he had
told his father at the end of it all the
sage was very silent and deep in thought
later the father left him to the stage
the old man spoke kindly to the land and
asked him some hard questions so clever
were the answers that the sage agreed to
educate the little fellow the boy
learned quickly what was taught to him
and was very obedient in most things but
even the sage noticed that the boy liked
to draw cats during study hours and to
draw cats even where cats ought not to
have been drawn at all
the stage called the boy's father your
son likes to draw cats and it is a gift
from the divine a gift that allows him
to talk to little kitty cats you don't
have to believe me if you don't but
listen to what I say Andy a long time
ago I had dreamt of cats and the next
town I think they may be late okay so do
I go there yes but remember the last
piece of advice that I want to give you
avoid drawing too many terrifying cats
at one place
Andy was very confused he didn't
understand what the sage meant by his
last advice but he thanked the sage and
went away his father however wasn't so
support 'fl and left him to do as he
wished he went on and soon reached the
town at night the town seemed too quiet
strange not a person around and all the
houses seemed shut I wonder if people
even live here the town had been
terrorized by an enormous which was
bigger than a cow it came only at night
so the people of the town went away by
night and during the day they would
return and stay indoors till it was time
to go out again
Andy roamed further and came upon a huge
house it was so beautiful and inviting
that Andy just had to go in it was in
this house that the people offered food
for the giant rat when Andy went in he
found the food and was so hungry that he
ate it all up
once he was done he realized that the
walls were all playing and white white
walls huge white walls holy one thing a
person like me can do here paint and
away he started to paint and as always
he painted great many cats upon the wall
well now they all looked so good but all
these paintings have made me really
tired
I should probably sleep for some time
[Music]
[Laughter]
[Music]
but Andy didn't sleep for long he was
suddenly woke up by a loud animal noise
Paul what he could hear snarling sounds
which only got louder and closer and he
got scared and went and hinted platitude
to test the Starling animal entered the
house and made such a noise that Andy
trembled very badly just then there were
loud noises the house trembled intensely
and the loud noises brought the town
people out of their homes what is that
noise let's go up there and see maybe
someone brave has come to save us from
the rat monster so they went to have a
look at what the curious sound could be
meanwhile back at the mansion the fight
was still going on and he was trembling
all over
the fight had finally ended and when
Andy heard the silence he peeped out
from his hiding spot and saw the giant
rat defeated and lying down on the floor
unconscious whoa what happened here his
eyes fell on his paintings and there he
saw a little blood on the cats what
exactly whoa the rut you finished off
the raft monster we had been terrorized
by it for so long oh thank you kind
stranger and II didn't know what to say
he was very surprised by everything he
then understood why the sage said avoid
drawing too many terrifying casts at one
place you're welcome and soon the tale
about Andy finishing off the monster rat
reached the world and as for Andy's
father well the news about Andy's
bravery soon reached him
I knew Andy had those powers for some
reason aren't you proud
[Music]
yes I am very proud of him in reality he
was a little ashamed of not having led
Andy follow his dreams in the first
place but he was glad now that his son
was finally happy and was doing what he
did the best drawing cats
Andy story teaches us that we must do
what we love and the universe will find
a way to make it magical
[Music]
